original: sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassitvā purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ
analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassitvā purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsa
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should send the monk Udāyī back to the beginning for one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen, committed while undertaking the trial period,🔽and it should then give him simultaneous probation for the first offense.

original: datvā chārattaṁ mānattaṁ detu.
analyzed: da tvā chārattam mānattam detu
translated: And it should then give him six days of trial.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, mūlāya paṭikassitabbo …pe….
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave mūlāya paṭikassitabbaḥ pe
translated: And, monks, he should be sent back to the beginning like this. …

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāso dātabbo …pe….🔽Evañca pana, bhikkhave, chārattaṁ mānattaṁ dātabbaṁ …pe…
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave purimāya āpattiyāḥ samodhāna parivāsaḥ dātabbaḥ pe  evam ca pana bhikkhave chārattam mānattam dātabbam pe
translated: And the probationary monk Udāyī should conduct himself properly.🔽And the monks should give him the trial period of six days.

original: deti …pe….
analyzed: da iti pe
translated: gives …🔽The Sangha has given the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.

original: Dinnaṁ saṅghena udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ.
analyzed: dinnam saṅghena udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānatta
translated: Since there is no dissent, the Sangha has given the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: I will remember it thus.’

original: 1.19. Abbhānārahamūlāyapaṭikassanādi
analyzed: abbhāna araha mūlāya paṭikassana ādi
translated: The sending back to the beginning of one deserving rehabilitation, etc.

original: So ciṇṇamānatto abbhānāraho antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajji sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ciṇṇa mānattaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna
translated: After completing that probation, he was deserving of rehabilitation, but in the interval he committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.

original: So bhikkhūnaṁ ārocesi—
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhūnam ārocesi
translated: He told the monks,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pakkhappaṭicchannaṁ …pe…
analyzed: aha āvuso ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pakkha ppaṭicchannam pe
translated: “I had committed one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for a half-month. …

original: sohaṁ ciṇṇamānatto abbhānāraho antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham ciṇṇa mānattaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna
translated: After completing that probation, I was deserving of rehabilitation, but in the interval I committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: How should I proceed?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.🔽“Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu  tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya
translated: They told the Buddha.🔽“Well then, the Sangha should send the monk Udāyī back to the beginning for one offense he’s admitted, concealed for five days.

original: sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassitvā purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ🔽datvā chārattaṁ mānattaṁ detu.
analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassitvā purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsa  da tvā chārattam mānattam detu
translated: It should then give him the trial period of six days for that offense.🔽And it should give him the trial period of six days like this.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, mūlāya paṭikassitabbo …pe….
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave mūlāya paṭikassitabbaḥ pe
translated: First you should accuse the monk Udāyī.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāso dātabbo …pe….
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave purimāya āpattiyāḥ samodhāna parivāsaḥ dātabbaḥ pe
translated: He should then be reminded of what he’s done, before he’s charged with an offense.🔽The most senior monk should then say to the Sangha:

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, chārattaṁ mānattaṁ dātabbaṁ …pe…🔽deti …pe….
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave chārattam mānattam dātabbam pe  da iti pe
translated: ‘Please listen, Venerables, while I explain the trial period of six days.

original: Dinnaṁ saṅghena udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ.
analyzed: dinnam saṅghena udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānatta
translated: The Sangha has given the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for one offense he’s admitted, concealed for five days.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha has consented. Therefore I will remember it thus.’”

original: 1.20. Pakkhappaṭicchannaabbhāna
analyzed: pakkha ppaṭicchanna abbhāna
translated: The rehabilitation of one who’s committed one concealed offense on the same day

original: So ciṇṇamānatto bhikkhūnaṁ ārocesi—
analyzed: saḥ ciṇṇa mānattaḥ bhikkhūnaṃ ārocesi
translated: When he had completed the trial period, he told the monks,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pakkhappaṭicchannaṁ …pe…
analyzed: aha āvuso ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pakkha ppaṭicchannam pe
translated: “I had committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen, for which I did not ask the Sangha for probation.

original: sohaṁ ciṇṇamānatto.
analyzed: saḥ aham ciṇṇa mānattaḥ
translated: I’ve now completed the trial period.

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: What should I do now?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ abbhetu.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum abbhetu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should rehabilitate the monk Udāyī.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, abbhetabbo—🔽Tena, bhikkhave, udāyinā bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā, ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā,
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave abbhetabbaḥ  tena bhikkhave udāyinā bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā
translated: And he should be rehabilitated like this.🔽The monk Udāyī should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms,

original: vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā, ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā, añjaliṁ paggahetvā, evamassa vacanīyo—🔽‘ahaṁ, bhante, ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pakkhappaṭicchannaṁ.
analyzed: vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ  aha bhante ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pakkha ppaṭicchanna
translated: and say:🔽‘Venerables, I had committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen, for which I did not ask the Sangha for probation.

original: Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pakkhappaṭicchannāya pakkhaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pakkha ppaṭicchannāya pakkha parivāsam yāci
translated: I’ve now completed the trial period.

original: Tassa me saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pakkhappaṭicchannāya pakkhaparivāsaṁ adāsi.🔽Sohaṁ parivasanto antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pakkha ppaṭicchannāya pakkha parivāsam adāsi  saḥ ham parivasantaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna
translated: The Sangha gave me probation for one part of that offense, which was concealed for a half-month.

original: Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāciṁ.🔽Taṁ maṁ saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci  tam mama saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi  saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: While on probation, I committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.🔽I asked the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for that offense, which was my first offense, and I’ve now completed the probation.🔽The Sangha has sent me back to the beginning for that offense, which was my first offense.

original: Tassa me saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: I asked the Sangha to give me probation simultaneous with the probation for the preceding offense,🔽and the Sangha has given me that probation.

original: Sohaṁ parivutthaparivāso mānattāraho antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivuttha parivāsaḥ mānatta ārahaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna  saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: I’ve now completed that probation and ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days.’🔽‘The Sangha has given monk so-and-so probation for one month for one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.

original: Taṁ maṁ saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: tam mama saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi  saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so probation for one month for one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.🔽He’s now completed that probation and has asked the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.🔽The Sangha has given monk so-and-so the trial period of six days for one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.

original: Tassa me saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.🔽Sohaṁ parivutthaparivāso saṅghaṁ tissannaṁ āpattīnaṁ chārattaṁ mānattaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi 🔽saḥ ham parivuttha parivāsaḥ saṅgham tissannam āpattīnam chārattam mānattam yāci
translated: I’ve now completed that probation and ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for the three offenses.’

original: Tassa me saṅgho tissannaṁ āpattīnaṁ chārattaṁ mānattaṁ adāsi.🔽Sohaṁ mānattaṁ caranto antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ tissannam āpattīnam chārattam mānattam adāsi  saḥ ham mānattam carantaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna
translated: The Sangha gave me the trial period of six days for three offenses.

original: Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāciṁ.🔽Taṁ maṁ saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci  tam mama saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi  saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: While on trial, I committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.🔽I asked the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for that offense,🔽and the Sangha sent me back to the beginning.

original: Tassa me saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: I asked the Sangha to give me the probation for that offense, concurrent with the probation for the previous offense,🔽and the Sangha gave me that probation.

original: Sohaṁ parivutthaparivāso saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivuttha parivāsaḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam yāci
translated: I’ve now completed that probation and have asked for the trial period of six days for that offense.

original: Tassa me saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ adāsi.🔽Sohaṁ ciṇṇamānatto abbhānāraho antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjiṁ sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam adāsi  saḥ ham ciṇṇa mānattaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna  saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: The Sangha has given me the trial period of six days for that offense.🔽While on probation, I committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.🔽I’ve now asked the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for that offense,

original: Taṁ maṁ saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.
analyzed: tam mama saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi
translated: and the Sangha has sent me back to the beginning.

original: Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: I ask the Sangha for probation for a half-month for that offense.🔽

original: Tassa me saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.🔽Sohaṁ parivutthaparivāso saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi  saḥ ham parivuttha parivāsaḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam yāci
translated: I asked the Sangha to give me probation for that offense, to be served concurrently with the previous probation.🔽The Sangha gave me that probation.🔽I’ve now completed that probation and asked the Sangha to give me the trial period of six days for that offense, to be served concurrently with the previous probation.

original: Tassa me saṅgho antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave me that trial period.

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, ciṇṇamānatto saṅghaṁ abbhānaṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ uha bhante ciṇṇa mānattaḥ saṅgham abbhānam yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi
translated: I now ask the Sangha for rehabilitation.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tatiyam pi
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ udāyī bhikkhu ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajji sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pakkhappaṭicchannaṁ.🔽So saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pakkhappaṭicchannāya pakkhaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: ayam udāyī bhikkhu ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pakkha ppaṭicchanna  saḥ saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pakkha ppaṭicchannāya pakkha parivāsam yāci
translated: The monk Udāyī has committed one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for a half-month.🔽He’s asked the Sangha for probation for that offense,

original: Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pakkhappaṭicchannāya pakkhaparivāsaṁ adāsi.🔽So parivasanto antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajji sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhuno ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pakkha ppaṭicchannāya pakkha parivāsam adāsi  saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna  saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: and the Sangha has given him that probation.🔽While on probation, he’s committed one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.🔽He’s asked the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for that offense,

original: Saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi
translated: and the Sangha has sent him back to the beginning.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: He asked the Sangha to give him the simultaneous probation for that offense, which it did.

original: Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.🔽So parivutthaparivāso mānattāraho antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajji sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi  saḥ parivuttha parivāsaḥ mānatta ārahaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna  saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: He then asked the Sangha to give him the trial period of six days for that offense, which it did.🔽While undertaking the trial period, he committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.

original: Saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi
translated: He asked the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for that offense, which it did.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāci.🔽Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci  saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: He’s asked the Sangha for a further probation for that offense, which was concealed for five days, to be served concurrently with the probation.🔽The Sangha has given him that concurrent probation.

original: So parivutthaparivāso saṅghaṁ tissannaṁ āpattīnaṁ chārattaṁ mānattaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ parivuttha parivāsaḥ saṅgham tissannam āpattīnam chārattam mānattam yāci
translated: He’s now asked the Sangha for the trial period of six days for three offenses,

original: Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno tissannaṁ āpattīnaṁ chārattaṁ mānattaṁ adāsi.🔽So mānattaṁ caranto antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajji sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhunaḥ tissannam āpattīnam chārattam mānattam adāsi  saḥ mānattam carantaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna
translated: and the Sangha has given him that.🔽While undertaking the trial period, he committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: He’s asked the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense to be served consecutively,

original: Saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi  saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: The Sangha has given monk Udāyī probation for one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for five days.🔽He’s now asking the Sangha for concurrent probation for that offense.

original: Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha has given monk Udāyī concurrent probation for that offense.

original: So parivutthaparivāso saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ parivuttha parivāsaḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam yāci
translated: He’s now completed that probation and is asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.

original: Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam adāsi
translated: The Sangha has given monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for that offense.

original: So ciṇṇamānatto abbhānāraho antarā ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajji sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pañcāhappaṭicchannaṁ.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ ciṇṇa mānattaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ antarā ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pañca aha ppaṭicchanna  saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: When he had completed the trial period, he asked the Sangha to give him the full ordination.🔽While he was waiting for the full ordination, he committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen, entailing suspension, that he had not previously acknowledged.

original: Saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya mūlāya paṭikassi
translated: He asked the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for that offense,🔽and the Sangha did.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: While he was waiting for the full ordination, he committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen, entailing suspension, that he had not previously acknowledged.🔽He asked the Sangha to give him simultaneous probation for that offense,

original: Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya purimāya āpattiyā samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha did.

original: So parivutthaparivāso saṅghaṁ antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ parivuttha parivāsaḥ saṅgham antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam yāci
translated: He’s now asked the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.

original: Saṅgho udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā pañcāhappaṭicchannāya chārattaṁ mānattaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyissa bhikkhuno antarā ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā pañca aha ppaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattam adāsi
translated: The Sangha has given the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for that offense.

original: So ciṇṇamānatto saṅghaṁ abbhānaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ ciṇṇa mānattaḥ saṅgham abbhānam yācati
translated: He’s now asking the Sangha for rehabilitation.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ abbheyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa patta kalla saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should rehabilitate the monk Udāyī.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ udāyī bhikkhu ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajji sañcetanikaṁ sukkavissaṭṭhiṁ pakkhappaṭicchannaṁ …pe…
analyzed: ayam udāyī bhikkhu ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim pakkha ppaṭicchannam pe
translated: The monk Udāyī has committed one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for a half-month. …

original: so ciṇṇamānatto saṅghaṁ abbhānaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ ciṇṇa mānattaḥ saṅgham abbhānam yācati
translated: He’s now asking the Sangha for rehabilitation.

original: Saṅgho udāyiṁ bhikkhuṁ abbheti.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati udāyissa bhikkhuno abbhānaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: saṅghaḥ udāyim bhikkhum abbheti  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati udāyissa bhikkhuno so tuṇhassa
translated: The Sangha rehabilitates the monk Udāyī.🔽Any monk who approves of rehabilitating him should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe….
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For a third time I say this matter …

original: Abbhito saṅghena udāyī bhikkhu.🔽Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: abbhitas saṅghena udāyī bhikkhu  khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha has lifted the suspension of the monk Udāyī.

original: Sukkavissaṭṭhi samattā.
analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhi samattā
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”🔽The rule on emission of semen is finished.

original: 2. Parivāsa
analyzed: parivāsa
translated: The trial period

original: 2.1. Agghasamodhānaparivāsa
analyzed: aggha samodhāna parivāsa
translated: The trial period for concealing offenses that are the most serious

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpanno hoti—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpanno hoti
translated: At one time a monk had committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:

original: ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti dvīhappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti tīhappaṭicchannā,
analyzed: ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā ekā āpatti dvīha ppaṭicchannā ekā āpatti tīha ppaṭicchannā
translated: one concealed for one day, one for two days, one for three days,

original: ekā āpatti catūhappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti pañcāhappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti chāhappaṭicchannā,
analyzed: ekā āpatti catūha ppaṭicchannā ekā āpatti pañcāha ppaṭicchannā ekā āpatti cha aha ppaṭicchannā
translated: one for four days, one for five days, one for six days,

original: ekā āpatti sattāhappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti aṭṭhāhappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti navāhappaṭicchannā,
analyzed: ekā āpatti satta aha ppaṭicchannā ekā āpatti aṭṭha aha ppaṭicchannā ekā āpatti nava aha ppaṭicchannā
translated: one for seven days, one for eight days, one for nine days,

original: ekā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā.
analyzed: ekā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā
translated: and one for ten days.

original: So bhikkhūnaṁ ārocesi—
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhūnam ārocesi
translated: He told the monks,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ—
analyzed: aha āvuso sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji
translated: “I’ve committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:

original: ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: one concealed for one day …

original: ekā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā.
analyzed: ekā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā
translated: One offense was concealed for ten days.

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: What should I do now?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho tassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā tassā agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ detu.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ tassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsam detu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should give that monk simultaneous probation for the offense that was concealed for ten days, starting from the day he concealed the first offense.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, dātabbo—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave dātabbaḥ
translated: And, monks, it should be given like this.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā …pe…
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā pe
translated: The monk should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms,

original: evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: and say:

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ—
analyzed: aha bhante sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji
translated: ‘Venerables, I’ve committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:

original: ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: one offense concealed for one day …

original: ekā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā.
analyzed: ekā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā
translated: one offense concealed for ten days.

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā tassā agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: sā uha bhante saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha paṭicchannā tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsam yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbo
translated: I ask the Sangha for simultaneous probation for that offense concealed for ten days, starting from the day I concealed the first offense.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbaḥ
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji—
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji
translated: The monk so-and-so has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:

original: ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: one offense concealed for one day …

original: ekā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā tassā agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha paṭicchannā tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: one offense concealed for ten days.🔽He’s asking the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses, starting with the offense concealed for ten days.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā tassā agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ dadeyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsam dadeyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give him that simultaneous probation.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji—
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji
translated: The monk so-and-so has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:

original: ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: one offense concealed for one day …

original: ekā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā.
analyzed: ekā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā
translated: one offense concealed for ten days.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā tassā agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha paṭicchannā tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses, starting with the offense concealed for ten days.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā tassā agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha paṭicchannā tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives the monk so-and-so probation according to the longest duration for the offense that was concealed for the most days.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā;🔽tassā agghena samodhānaparivāsassa dānaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā  tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsassa saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of giving that monk probation according to the longest duration for the offense that was concealed for the most days should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe….
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpatti dasāhappaṭicchannā tassā agghena samodhānaparivāso.
analyzed: dinnaḥ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yā āpatti dasa aha ppaṭicchannā tassāḥ agghena samodhāna parivāsaḥ
translated: The Sangha has given the monk so-and-so probation according to the longest duration for the offense that was concealed for the most days.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: Since there is silence, I will regard this matter as approved by the Sangha.’”

original: 2.2. Sabbacirappaṭicchannaagghasamodhāna
analyzed: sabba cira ppaṭicchanna aggha samodhāna
translated: … Probation according to the longest duration for the offense that was concealed for the most days

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpanno hoti—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpanno hoti
translated: On one occasion a monk had committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:

original: ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā, dve āpattiyo dvīhappaṭicchannāyo, tisso āpattiyo tīhappaṭicchannāyo,
analyzed: ekā āpatti eka aha paṭicchannā dve āpattiyaḥ dvīha ppaṭicchannāyaḥ tisso āpattiyaḥ tīha ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: One offense concealed for one day, two offenses concealed for two days, three offenses concealed for three days,

original: catasso āpattiyo catūhappaṭicchannāyo, pañca āpattiyo pañcāhappaṭicchannāyo, cha
analyzed: catasso āpattiyo catūha ppaṭicchannāyo pañca āpattiyo pañcāha ppaṭicchannāyo cha
translated: four offenses concealed for four days, five offenses concealed for five days, six

original: āpattiyo chāhappaṭicchannāyo, satta āpattiyo sattāhappaṭicchannāyo, aṭṭha āpattiyo
analyzed: āpattiyo cha aha paṭicchannāyo satta āpattiyaḥ sattāha paṭicchannāyaḥ aṭṭha āpattiyaḥ
translated: offenses concealed for six days, seven offenses concealed for seven days, eight

original: aṭṭhāhappaṭicchannāyo, nava āpattiyo navāhappaṭicchannāyo, dasa āpattiyo dasāhappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aṭṭha aha paṭicchannāyaḥ nava āpattiyaḥ nava aha ppaṭicchannāyaḥ dasa āpattiyaḥ dasa aha ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: offenses concealed for eight days, nine offenses concealed for nine days, and ten offenses concealed for ten days.

original: So bhikkhūnaṁ ārocesi—
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhūnam ārocesi
translated: He told the monks,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ, ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: aha āvuso sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: “I’ve committed a number of offenses entailing suspension. One offense I’ve concealed for one day …

original: dasa āpattiyo dasāhappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: dasa āpattiyaḥ
translated: Ten offenses I’ve concealed for ten days.

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: What should I do now?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho tassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ detu.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ tassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyo sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsam detu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should give that monk simultaneous probation for the most serious of those offenses.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, dātabbo—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave dātabbaḥ
translated: And it should be given like this.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā …pe…
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā pe
translated: The monk should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms,

original: evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: and say:

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ, ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: aha bhante sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: ‘Venerables, I’ve committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, concealed for one day …

original: dasa āpattiyo dasāhappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: dasa āpattiyaḥ
translated: and concealed for ten days.

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: sā uha bhante saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyo sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsam yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbo
translated: I ask the Sangha for simultaneous probation for the most serious of those offenses.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbaḥ
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji, ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: The monk so-and-so has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, one concealed for one day …

original: dasa āpattiyo dasāhappaṭicchannāyo.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: dasa āpattiyaḥ  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyaḥ sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: ten concealed for ten days.🔽He’s asking the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses, starting with the one concealed the longest.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ dadeyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa patta kallam saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyo sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsam dadeyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give him that simultaneous probation.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.🔽Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji—
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ  ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā …pe…
analyzed: ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā pe
translated: The monk so-and-so has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, one concealed for one day …

original: dasa āpattiyo dasāhappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: dasa āpattiyaḥ
translated: ten concealed for ten days.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyaḥ sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses, starting with the one concealed the longest.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyo sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives the monk so-and-so a simultaneous probation for the most recent offense or offenses among those offenses that he’s admitted, whether or not they’re recognized.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāsassa dānaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyo sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsassa so tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of giving the monk so-and-so a simultaneous probation for the most recent offense or offenses among those offenses that he’s admitted, whether or not they’re recognized, should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe….
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ yā āpattiyo sabbacirappaṭicchannāyo tāsaṁ agghena samodhānaparivāso.
analyzed: dinnaḥ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tāsam āpattīnam yāḥ āpattiyo sabba cira paṭicchannāyaḥ tāsam agghena samodhāna parivāsaḥ
translated: The Sangha has given the monk so-and-so a simultaneous probation for the most recent offense or offenses among those offenses that he’s admitted, whether or not they’re recognized.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: Since there’s silence, I regard the Sangha as approving. I’ll therefore remember it thus.’”

original: 2.3. Dvemāsaparivāsa
analyzed: dve māsa parivāsa
translated: … Probation for two months

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpanno hoti dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpannaḥ hoti dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyo
translated: On one occasion a monk had committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Tassa etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for one of those offenses?’🔽He then asked the Sangha for probation for two months for one of those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha gave him that probation.

original: Tassa parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While on probation, he was overcome by shame and scruples,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Tassa me etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa me etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti 🔽saḥ ham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for one of those offenses?’🔽And I asked the Sangha for that probation,

original: Tassa me saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave me probation for two months for that offense.

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While I was on probation, I was overcome by shame.

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti
translated: I should ask the Sangha for probation for two months for the other offense as well.’

original: So bhikkhūnaṁ ārocesi—
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhūnam ārocesi
translated: He told the monks,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aha āvuso dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months each.

original: Tassa me etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa me etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.

translated: I should ask the Sangha for probation for two months for one of them.’🔽I asked the Sangha for probation for two months for one of them,

original: Tassa me saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha gave me that probation.

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While I was on probation, I was overcome by shame.

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Tassa me etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa me etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”’ti.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ ham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for one of those offenses?’🔽I then asked the Sangha for probation for two months for one of those offenses,

original: Tassa me saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha gave me that probation.

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While on probation, I was overcome with shame and had this thought:

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti
translated: ‘Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for the other offense too?’

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: What should I do now?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.🔽The Buddha said,

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho tassa bhikkhuno itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ detu.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ tassa bhikkhuno itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam detu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should give that monk probation for two months for the other offense concealed for two months.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, dātabbo—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave dātabbaḥ
translated: And, monks, it should be given like this.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā, ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā, vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā, ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā, añjaliṁ paggahetvā, evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: That monk should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aha bhante dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Tassa me etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa me etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: “I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti 🔽saḥ ham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: Let me ask the Sangha for probation for one month for one of those offenses.”🔽And I’ve asked the Sangha for that probation.

original: Tassa me saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave me probation for two months for that offense.

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While I was on probation, I was overcome by shame and abashed.

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: I had committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Tassa me etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa me etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha gave me probation for one of those offenses.

analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While I was on probation, I was overcome by shame and abashed.

original: “yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha to give me probation for the other offense as well?”

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: sā uha bhante saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbo
translated: I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for that offense too.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbaḥ
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ

analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi

translated: And he’s asking the Sangha for probation for one month for the other offense too.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ dadeyya.

translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give the monk so-and-so probation for two months for the other offense, concealed for two months.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsassa dānaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsassa dāna saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of giving that monk probation for two months for the other offense concealed for two months should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe….
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāso.
analyzed: dinnaḥ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsaḥ
translated: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so probation for two months for the other offense concealed for two months.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: Since there’s silence, I regard the Sangha as approving.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tadupādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā tat upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: That monk should undertake that probation for two months.

original: 2.4. Dvemāsāparivasitabbavidhi
translated: … The process for giving probation for two months

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
