analyzed: tassa parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: thinking,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Tassa me etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa me etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: “I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ ham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for one of those offenses?”

original: Tassa me saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: And I asked the Sangha for that probation,🔽and the Sangha gave me that probation.

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While he was doing that, a sense of shame came over him,

original: “yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti
translated: and he thought, ‘Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for that other offense as well?’

original: So saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham itarissā api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: He then asked the Sangha for probation for two months for that other offense as well,

original: Tassa saṅgho itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gave him that probation.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tadupādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā tat upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should then undertake the trial period of two months.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk commits two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti, ekaṁ āpattiṁ na jānāti.🔽So saṅghaṁ yaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti, tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekam āpattim jānāti ekam āpattim na jānāti  saḥ saṅgham yam āpattim jānāti tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: He knows about one of them, but not about the other.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for two months for the offense he knows about,🔽and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: Tassa saṅgho tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.🔽So parivasanto itarampi āpattiṁ jānāti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tassaḥ āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam deti 🔽saḥ parivasantaḥ itaram pi āpattim jānāti
translated: While on probation, he finds out about the other offense.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekaṁ āpattiṁ jāniṁ, ekaṁ āpattiṁ na jāniṁ.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ yaṁ āpattiṁ jāniṁ tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: ekam āpattim jāni ekam āpattim na jāni  saḥ ham saṅgham yam āpattim tassā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: I remember one offense, but I don’t remember the other.

original: Tassa me saṅgho tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: I’ve asked the Sangha to give me probation for that offense, which it has done.

original: Sohaṁ parivasanto itarampi āpattiṁ jānāmi.
analyzed: saḥ aham parivasantaḥ itaram pi āpattim jānāmi
translated: While on probation, I’ve remembered the other offense.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ saṅgham itarissā api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: Let me ask the Sangha to give me probation for that offense too.’🔽He then asks the Sangha to give him probation for that offense,

original: Tassa saṅgho itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives it to him.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tadupādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā tat upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should undertake it for two months.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: “It may be that a monk commits two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekaṁ āpattiṁ sarati, ekaṁ āpattiṁ nassarati.🔽So saṅghaṁ yaṁ āpattiṁ sarati, tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekam āpattim sarati ekam āpattim na ssarati  saḥ saṅgham yam āpattim sarati tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: He remembers one of them, but not the other.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for the offense that he remembers, which is concealed for two months.

original: Tassa saṅgho tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tassaḥ āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him that probation.

original: So parivasanto itarampi āpattiṁ sarati.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ itaram pi āpattim sarati
translated: While on probation, he remembers the other offense.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekaṁ āpattiṁ sariṁ, ekaṁ āpattiṁ nassariṁ.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ yaṁ āpattiṁ sariṁ, tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: ekam āpattim sari ekam āpattim nassari  saḥ ham saṅgham yam āpattim sari tassā āpattiyā dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: I remember one of them, but not the other.🔽I asked the Sangha to give me probation for the offense that I remembered, which was concealed for two months.🔽The Sangha gave me that probation.

original: Tassa me saṅgho tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.🔽Sohaṁ parivasanto itarampi āpattiṁ sarāmi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi 🔽saḥ aham parivasantaḥ itaram pi āpattim sarāmi
translated: While on probation, I’ve remembered the other offense.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ saṅgham itarissā api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for two months for that offense too?”🔽He then asks the Sangha for probation for two months for that offense too.

original: Tassa saṅgho itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him that probation.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tadupādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā tat upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should undertake that probation for two months.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk commits two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekāya āpattiyā nibbematiko, ekāya āpattiyā vematiko.🔽So saṅghaṁ yāya āpattiyā nibbematiko, tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekāya āpattiyā nibbematikaḥ ekāya āpattiyā vematikaḥ  saḥ saṅgham yāya āpattiyā nibbematikaḥ tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s sure about one of them, but unsure about the other.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for two months for the offense he’s sure about.

original: Tassa saṅgho tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tassaḥ āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him that probation.

original: So parivasanto itarissāpi āpattiyā nibbematiko hoti.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ itarissa api āpattiyā nibbematikaḥ hoti
translated: While on probation, he becomes sure about the other offense too.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: ekāya āpattiyā nibbematiko, ekāya āpattiyā vematiko.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ yāya āpattiyā nibbematiko tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: ekāya āpattiyā nibbematikaḥ ekāya āpattiyā vematikaḥ  saḥ ham saṅgham yāya āpattiyā nibbematikaḥ tassā āpattiyā dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: I’m sure of one, but unsure of the other.🔽I’ve asked the Sangha to give me probation for two months for that offense of which I’m sure,

original: Tassa me saṅgho tassā āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha has given me that probation.

original: Sohaṁ parivasanto itarissāpi āpattiyā nibbematiko.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivasantaḥ itarissa api āpattiyā nibbematikaḥ
translated: But while on probation, I’m sure of the other offense as well.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dve māsa paṭicchannāya dve māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ saṅgham itarissā api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: Well, I’ll ask the Sangha to give me probation for two months for that offense as well.’🔽He then asks the Sangha to give him probation for two months for that offense as well,

original: Tassa saṅgho itarissāpi āpattiyā dvemāsappaṭicchannāya dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ itarissa api āpattiyāḥ dvi māsa paṭicchannāya dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tadupādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā tat upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should then undertake the trial period of two months.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk commits two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekā āpatti jānappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti ajānappaṭicchannā.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekā āpatti jāna paṭicchannā ekā āpatti a jāna paṭicchannā  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa ppaṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: One offense he conceals, knowing it’s an offense, and one offense he conceals, not knowing it’s an offense.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for two months for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: Tassa parivasantassa añño bhikkhu āgacchati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
analyzed: tassa parivasantassa aññaḥ bhikkhu āgacchati bahu ssutaḥ āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: While he’s on probation, another monk arrives who is learned and a master of the tradition; who is an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He asks,

original: ‘kiṁ ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno?
analyzed: kim āvuso bhikkhu āpanno
translated: ‘What offense has this monk committed?

original: Kissāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti?
analyzed: kissa ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: Why is he on probation?’

original: Te evaṁ vadenti—
analyzed: te evam vadenti
translated: They reply,

original: ‘ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: āvuso bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘This monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekā āpatti jānappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti ajānappaṭicchannā.
analyzed: ekā āpatti jāna paṭicchannā ekā āpatti a jāna paṭicchannā
translated: One offense he concealed, knowing it was an offense, and one offense he concealed, not knowing it was an offense.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa ppaṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for two months for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha has given him that probation.

original: Tāyo ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno, tāsāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti.
analyzed: tāyaḥ āvuso bhikkhu āpanno tāsā ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: This monk has committed those offenses and is undertaking that probation.’

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He says,

original: ‘yāyaṁ, āvuso, āpatti jānappaṭicchannā, dhammikaṁ tassā āpattiyā parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: yāya āvuso āpatti jāna paṭicchannā dhammikam tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ parivāsa dāna
translated: ‘The giving of probation for the offense that was concealed and then admitted is legitimate.

original: dhammattā ruhati.
analyzed: dhammattā ruhati
translated: It stands.

original: Yā ca khvāyaṁ, āvuso, āpatti ajānappaṭicchannā, adhammikaṁ tassā āpattiyā parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: yā ca khvāyaḥ āvuso āpatti a jāna paṭicchannā adhammikam tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ parivāsa dāna
translated: But the giving of probation for the offense that was concealed but not admitted is illegitimate.

original: adhammattā na ruhati.
analyzed: a dhammattā na ruhati
translated: It doesn’t stand.

original: Ekissā, āvuso, āpattiyā bhikkhu mānattāraho’ti.
analyzed: ekissā āvuso āpattiyā bhikkhu mānatta āraho ti
translated: A monk who’s committed one offense deserves the trial period.’

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months,

original: ekā āpatti saramānappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti assaramānappaṭicchannā.
analyzed: ekā āpatti saramāna paṭicchannā ekā āpatti assaramāna paṭicchannā
translated: one offense concealed for the period of one day and one offense concealed for a period of less than one day.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa ppaṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for two months for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha has given him that probation.

original: Tassa parivasantassa añño bhikkhu āgacchati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
analyzed: tassa parivasantassa aññaḥ bhikkhu āgacchati bahu ssutaḥ āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: While he’s on probation, another monk arrives who is learned and a master of the tradition; who is an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He asks,

original: ‘kiṁ ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno?
analyzed: kim āvuso bhikkhu āpanno
translated: ‘What offense has this monk committed?

original: Kissāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti?
analyzed: kissa ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: Why is he on probation?’

original: Te evaṁ vadenti—
analyzed: te evam vadenti
translated: They reply,

original: ‘ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: āvuso bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘This monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekā āpatti saramānappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti assaramānappaṭicchannā.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: ekā āpatti saramāna paṭicchannā ekā āpatti assaramāna paṭicchannā  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa ppaṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: One offense he remembers having committed, and one he doesn’t remember having committed.🔽He’s asking the Sangha for probation for two months for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha has given him that probation.

original: Tāyo ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno;
analyzed: tāyaḥ ayaṃ āvuso bhikkhu āpanno
translated: This monk has committed three offenses.

original: tāsāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti.🔽So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: bhikkhu parivasati iti  sā u evam vada iti
translated: This monk is undertaking the trial period for those offenses.’

original: ‘yāyaṁ, āvuso, āpatti saramānappaṭicchannā dhammikaṁ tassā āpattiyā parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: yāya āvuso āpatti saramāna paṭicchannā dhammikam tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ parivāsa dāna
translated: He says, ‘The giving of the trial period for the offense that I remember and have concealed is legitimate.

original: dhammattā ruhati.
analyzed: dhammattā ruhati
translated: It’s legitimate because of me.

original: Yā ca khvāyaṁ, āvuso, āpatti assaramānappaṭicchannā, adhammikaṁ tassā āpattiyā parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: yā ca khvāyaḥ āvuso āpatti assaramāna paṭicchannā adhammikam tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ parivāsa dāna
translated: The giving of the trial period for the offense that I don’t remember and have concealed is illegitimate.

original: adhammattā na ruhati.
analyzed: a dhammattā na ruhati
translated: It’s illegitimate because of me.

original: Ekissā, āvuso, āpattiyā bhikkhu mānattāraho’ti.
analyzed: ekissā āvuso āpattiyā bhikkhu mānatta āraho ti
translated: This monk deserves the trial period for one offense.’

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekā āpatti nibbematikappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti vematikappaṭicchannā.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekā āpatti nibbematika paṭicchannā ekā āpatti vematika paṭicchannā  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa ppaṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: One offense he’s sure of, and one he’s unsure of.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for two months for those two offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him that probation.

analyzed: tassa parivasantassa aññaḥ bhikkhu āgacchati bahu ssutaḥ āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: While he’s doing that, another monk arrives—one who is learned and a master of the tradition; who is an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He asks,

original: ‘kiṁ ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno?
analyzed: kim āvuso bhikkhu āpanno
translated: ‘What has this monk committed?

original: Kissāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti?
analyzed: kissa ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: Why is he undertaking the trial period?’

original: Te evaṁ vadenti—
analyzed: te evam vadenti
translated: They reply,

original: ‘ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: āvuso bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘This monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekā āpatti nibbematikappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti vematikappaṭicchannā.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: ekā āpatti nibbematika paṭicchannā ekā āpatti vematika paṭicchannā  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa ppaṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: One offense is concealed for a definite period, and one is concealed for an indefinite period.🔽He’s asked the Sangha to give him probation for two months for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam dvi māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha has given him that probation.

original: Tāyo ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno;
analyzed: tāyaḥ ayaṃ āvuso bhikkhu āpanno
translated: This monk has committed those offenses,

original: tāsāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti.
analyzed: bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: and he’s undertaking the trial period for them.’

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He says,

original: ‘yāyaṁ, āvuso, āpatti nibbematikappaṭicchannā, dhammikaṁ tassā āpattiyā parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: yāya āvuso āpatti nibbematika paṭicchannā dhammikam tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ parivāsa dāna
translated: ‘If an offense is concealed and certain, the giving of the trial period for that offense is legitimate.

original: dhammattā ruhati.
analyzed: dhammattā ruhati
translated: Because it’s legitimate, it stands.

original: Yā ca khvāyaṁ, āvuso, āpatti vematikappaṭicchannā adhammikaṁ tassā āpattiyā parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: yā ca khvāyaḥ āvuso āpatti vematika paṭicchannā adhammikam tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ parivāsa dāna
translated: But if an offense is concealed and uncertain, the giving of the trial period for that offense is illegitimate.

original: adhammattā na ruhati.
analyzed: a dhammattā na ruhati
translated: Because it’s illegitimate, it doesn’t stand.

original: Ekissā, āvuso, āpattiyā bhikkhu mānattāraho’”ti.
analyzed: ekissā āvuso āpattiyā bhikkhu mānatta āraho ti
translated: A monk who’s committed one offense is deserving of the trial period.’”

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpanno hoti dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpannaḥ hoti dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyo
translated: On one occasion a monk had committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Tassa etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: “I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: Let me ask the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses.”🔽He asked the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha gave him that probation.

original: Tassa parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While I was doing that, a sense of shame came over me,

translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.

translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses?’🔽I then asked the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses,

original: Tassa me saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam adāsi

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami.
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While I was on probation, a sense of shame came over me,

translated: I thought:

translated: Let me ask the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses.’🔽And I asked the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses,

analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, dātabbo—

analyzed: evam assa vacanīyaḥ

translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses?’🔽And I asked the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses,

analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam adāsi

analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ

translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses?’🔽And I asked the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses,

original: Tassa me saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave me probation for one month for those two offenses.

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—🔽“yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami  yat nūna aham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yāceyyanti
translated: While I was on probation, I was overcome by shame.🔽I thought, ‘Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for the remaining month for those two offenses?’

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: sā uha bhante saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbo
translated: I ask the Sangha for probation for the remaining month for those two offenses.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbaḥ
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—🔽‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ  suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, this monk has fallen into two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Tassa etadahosi—
analyzed: tassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: “I’ve fallen into two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam yāceyyanti
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for one month for those two offenses?”

original: So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: He asked the Sangha for probation for one month for two offenses entailing suspension, concealed for two months.

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam eka māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave him that probation.

original: Tassa parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami—
analyzed: tassa parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: While on probation, he was overcome by shame and scruples,

original: “ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ

original: Tassa me etadahosi—🔽ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo—

original: “yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ ekamāsaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.

translated: I should ask the Sangha for probation for one month for those offenses.”🔽I asked the Sangha for that probation,

original: Tassa me parivasantassa lajjīdhammo okkami.
analyzed: tassa me parivasantassa lajjī dhammaḥ okkami
translated: But while on probation, I was overcome by shame and scruples.

original: “Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāceyyan”ti.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ dadeyya.

translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give him probation for the remaining month for the other offense.

original: Esā ñatti.

translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.

translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for the remaining month for those two offenses.🔽The Sangha gives him that probation.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsassa dānaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa ppaṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsassa so tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of giving him that probation should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe….
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāso.
analyzed: dinnaḥ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhunaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa ppaṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsaḥ
translated: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so probation for the remaining month for those two offenses concealed for two months.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: Since there’s silence, I regard the Sangha as approving.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā purimaṁ upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā purimam upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should do probation for two months, counting from the first day.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.

translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekaṁ māsaṁ jāniṁ, ekaṁ māsaṁ na jāniṁ.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ jāniṁ taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: ekam māsam jāni ekam māsam na jāni  saḥ uham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam jānim tam māsam parivāsam yāci
translated: I knew about one month, but not about the other.🔽I asked the Sangha for probation for the month I knew about,

original: Tassa me saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ jāniṁ taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam jānim tam māsam parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha gave me that probation.

original: Sohaṁ parivasanto itarampi māsaṁ jānāmi.
analyzed: saḥ aham itaram pi māsam jānāmi
translated: I know that I’ve been on probation for a month.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yācati
translated: Why don’t I ask the Sangha for probation for the remaining month for those two offenses?’🔽He then asks the Sangha for probation for the remaining month for those two offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā purimaṁ upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā purimam upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should then stay on probation for two months, counting from the first day.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk commits two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekaṁ māsaṁ sarati, ekaṁ māsaṁ nassarati.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ sarati taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekam māsam sarati ekam māsam na ssarati  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam sarati tam māsam parivāsam yācati
translated: He remembers one month, but not the other.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for the month he remembers,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ sarati taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam sarati tam māsam parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: So parivasanto itarampi māsaṁ sarati.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ itaram pi māsam sarati
translated: While on probation, he remembers the other offense.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—🔽‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: tassa evam hoti  aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: He thinks,

original: ekaṁ māsaṁ sariṁ, ekaṁ māsaṁ nassariṁ.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ sariṁ taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: ekam māsam ekam māsam nassari  saḥ mama saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam tam māsam parivāsam yāci
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.🔽I’ve remembered one month, but not the other.🔽I’ve asked the Sangha to give me probation for the month I remember.

original: Tassa me saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ sariṁ taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam sarim tam māsam parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha has given me probation for that month.

original: Sohaṁ parivasanto itarampi māsaṁ sarāmi.
analyzed: saḥ aham parivasantaḥ itaram pi māsam sarāmi
translated: But while on probation, I’ve remembered the other month.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yāceyyanti  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yācati
translated: Let me ask the Sangha to give me probation for the other month.’🔽He asks the Sangha to give him probation for the other month.

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him probation for the other month.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā purimaṁ upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā purimam upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should then live on probation for two months, counting from the first offense.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;🔽ekaṁ māsaṁ nibbematiko, ekaṁ māsaṁ vematiko.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ nibbematiko taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ  ekam māsam nibbematikaḥ ekam māsam vematikaḥ  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam nibbematikaḥ tam māsam parivāsam yācati
translated: “It may be that a monk commits two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.🔽For one month he’s sure of it, and for one month he’s unsure.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for the month he’s sure of,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ nibbematiko taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam nibbematikaḥ tam māsam parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: So parivasanto itarampi māsaṁ nibbematiko hoti.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ itaram pi māsam nibbematikaḥ hoti
translated: While on probation, he becomes sure of the other month as well.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: aham kho dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim dvi māsa paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘I’ve committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: ekaṁ māsaṁ nibbematiko, ekaṁ māsaṁ vematiko.
analyzed: ekam māsam nibbematikaḥ ekam māsam vematikaḥ
translated: For one month I was sure of it, and for one month I was unsure.🔽I asked the Sangha to give me probation for the month I was sure of,

original: Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ nibbematiko taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam yam māsam nibbematikaḥ tam māsam parivāsam yāci
translated: and it did.

original: Tassa me saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchānnānaṁ yaṁ māsaṁ nibbematiko taṁ māsaṁ parivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchānnānam yam māsam nibbematikaḥ tam māsam parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave me probation for one month for the offense that I was sure about.

original: Sohaṁ parivasanto itarampi māsaṁ nibbematiko.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivasantaḥ itaram pi māsam nibbematikaḥ
translated: While on probation, I became sure about the other offense as well.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yāceyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yāceyyanti
translated: I should ask the Sangha for probation for the other month.’

original: So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam yācati
translated: He then asked the Sangha for probation for the other month,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ itarampi māsaṁ parivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dvi māsa paṭicchannānam itaram pi māsam parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gave him that probation.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā purimaṁ upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave bhikkhunā purimam upādāya dve māsā parivasitabbā
translated: He should do probation for two months, counting from the first day.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk commits two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: eko māso jānappaṭicchanno, eko māso ajānappaṭicchanno.
analyzed: ekaḥ māsaḥ jāna paṭicchannaḥ ekaḥ māsaḥ a jāna paṭicchannaḥ
translated: One month is concealed because he knows about it, and one month is concealed because he doesn’t know about it.

original: So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa ppaṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for two offenses concealed for two months.

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha has given him that probation.

original: Tassa parivasantassa añño bhikkhu āgacchati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
analyzed: tassa parivasantassa aññaḥ bhikkhu āgacchati bahu ssutaḥ āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: While he’s on probation, another monk arrives who is learned and a master of the tradition; who is an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He asks,

original: ‘kiṁ ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno?
analyzed: kim āvuso bhikkhu āpanno
translated: ‘What offense has this monk committed?

original: Kissāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti?
analyzed: kissa ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: Why is he on probation?’

original: Te evaṁ vadenti—
analyzed: te evam vadenti
translated: They reply,

original: ‘ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajji dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: āvuso bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘This monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: Eko māso jānappaṭicchanno, eko māso ajānappaṭicchanno.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: ekaḥ māsaḥ jāna paṭicchannaḥ ekaḥ māsaḥ a jāna paṭicchannaḥ  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa ppaṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: One month was concealed knowingly, and one month was concealed unknowingly.🔽He asked the Sangha to give him probation for two months for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha gave him that probation.

original: Tāyo ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno tāsāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti.
analyzed: tāyaḥ āvuso bhikkhu āpanno tāsā ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: ‘This monk has committed three offenses entailing suspension, and he’s undertaking the trial period for all of them.’

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He says,

original: ‘yvāyaṁ, āvuso, māso jānappaṭicchanno dhammikaṁ tassa māsassa parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: āvuso māsaḥ jāna paṭicchannaḥ dhammikam tassa māsassa
translated: ‘The giving of the trial period for that month when he was concealing his offenses is legitimate.

original: dhammattā ruhati.
analyzed: dhammattā ruhati
translated: It’s legitimate because of his consent.

original: Yo ca khvāyaṁ, āvuso, māso ajānappaṭicchanno adhammikaṁ tassa māsassa parivāsadānaṁ;
analyzed: yaḥ ca khvāyaḥ āvuso māsaḥ a jāna paṭicchannaḥ adhammikam tassa māsassa
translated: The giving of the trial period for that month when he wasn’t concealing his offenses is illegitimate.

original: adhammattā na ruhati.
analyzed: a dhammattā na ruhati
translated: It’s illegitimate because of his non-consent.

original: Ekassa, āvuso, māsassa bhikkhu mānattāraho’ti.
analyzed: ekassa āvuso māsassa bhikkhu mānattāraho ti
translated: This monk deserves the trial period for one month.’

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for one month.

original: eko māso saramānappaṭicchanno, eko māso assaramānappaṭicchanno.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: ekaḥ māso saramāna paṭicchanno ekaḥ māso a saramāna paṭicchanno  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa ppaṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam yācati
translated: One month he concealed because he was unsure, and one month he concealed because he was sure.🔽He asks the Sangha for probation for two months for those two offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: Tassa parivasantassa añño bhikkhu āgacchati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
analyzed: tassa parivasantassa aññaḥ bhikkhu āgacchati bahu ssutaḥ āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: While he’s doing that, another monk arrives—one who is learned and a master of the tradition; who is an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

original: So evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sā u evam vada iti
translated: He asks,

original: ‘kiṁ ayaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āpanno?
analyzed: kim āvuso bhikkhu āpanno
translated: ‘What has this monk committed?

original: Kissāyaṁ bhikkhu parivasatī’ti?
analyzed: kissa ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti
translated: Why is he undertaking the trial period?’

original: Te evaṁ vadenti—
analyzed: te evam vadenti
translated: They reply,

analyzed: āvuso bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajji dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: ‘This monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.

original: eko māso saramānappaṭicchanno, eko māso assaramānappaṭicchanno.🔽So saṅghaṁ dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ yāci.
analyzed: ekaḥ māso saramāna paṭicchanno ekaḥ māso a saramāna paṭicchanno  saḥ saṅgham dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa ppaṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam yāci
translated: One month he’s remembered, and one month he hasn’t.🔽He’s asked the Sangha for probation for two months for those two offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho dvinnaṁ āpattīnaṁ dvemāsappaṭicchannānaṁ dvemāsaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ dvinnam āpattīnam dve māsa paṭicchannānam dve māsa parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha has given him that probation.

analyzed: tāyaḥ āvuso bhikkhu āpanno tāsā ayam bhikkhu parivasati iti

analyzed: āvuso māsaḥ saramāna paṭicchannaḥ dhammikam tassa māsassa
translated: ‘The month that he’s concealed is legitimate.

original: dhammattā ruhati.
analyzed: dhammattā ruhati
translated: It’s legitimate because of the rule.

analyzed: yaḥ ca khvāyaḥ āvuso māsaḥ adhammikam tassa māsassa parivāsa dāna
translated: The month that he hasn’t concealed is illegitimate.

original: adhammattā na ruhati.
analyzed: a dhammattā na ruhati
translated: It’s illegitimate because of the rule.

original: Ekassa, āvuso, māsassa bhikkhu mānattāraho’ti.
analyzed: ekassa āvuso māsassa bhikkhu mānattāraho ti
translated: A monk who deserves the trial period for one month.’

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dve saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati dvemāsappaṭicchannāyo;
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu dve saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati dvi māsa ppaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: “It may be that a monk has committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for one month.
