analyzed: yaḥ chādeti saḥ dukkaṭam desāpetabbaḥ  ubho api yathādhammam kārāpetabbā
translated: The one who conceals it should be made to confess an act of wrong conduct.🔽Both should then be dealt with according to the rule.

original: Dve bhikkhū suddhakaṁ āpannā honti.
analyzed: dve bhikkhū suddhakam āpannā honti
translated: Two monks have committed a light offense.

original: Te suddhake suddhakadiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: te suddhake suddhaka diṭṭhinaḥ honti
translated: They regard it as a light offense.

original: Eko chādeti, eko nacchādeti.
analyzed: ekaḥ chāda iti ekaḥ na chāda iti
translated: One conceals it and the other doesn’t.

original: Yo chādeti so dukkaṭaṁ desāpetabbo.🔽Ubhopi yathādhammaṁ kārāpetabbā.
analyzed: yaḥ chādeti saḥ dukkaṭam desāpetabbaḥ  ubho api yathādhammam kārāpetabbā
translated: The one who conceals it should be made to confess an act of wrong conduct.🔽Both should then be dealt with according to the rule.

original: Dve bhikkhū saṅghādisesaṁ āpannā honti.
analyzed: dve bhikkhū saṅgha ādisesam āpannāḥ honti
translated: Two monks have committed a serious offense.

original: Te saṅghādisese saṅghādisesadiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: te saṅgha adisese saṅgha ādisesa diṭṭhinaḥ honti
translated: They regard it as a serious offense.

original: Ekassa hoti ārocessāmīti, ekassa hoti na ārocessāmīti.
analyzed: ekassa hoti ārocessāmi iti ekassa hoti na ārocessāmi iti
translated: One thinks, “I’ll tell,” while the other thinks, “I won’t tell.”

original: So paṭhamampi yāmaṁ chādeti, dutiyampi yāmaṁ chādeti, tatiyampi yāmaṁ chādeti—🔽uṭṭhite aruṇe channā hoti āpatti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭhamam pi yāmam chādeti dutiyam pi yāmam chādeti tatiyam pi yāmam chādeti  uṭṭhite aruṇe channā hoti āpatti
translated: The first conceals it during the first part of the night, during the second part of the night, and during the third part of the night.🔽When dawn has risen, the offense is concealed.

original: Yo chādeti so dukkaṭaṁ desāpetabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ chādeti saḥ dukkaṭam desāpetabbaḥ
translated: The one who conceals it should be made to confess an act of wrong conduct.

original: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṁ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṁ dātabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā paṭicchanne cassa parivāsam da tvā ubhinnam pi mānattam dātabba
translated: When they have each been given the trial period, probation should be given to both of them.

original: Dve bhikkhū saṅghādisesaṁ āpannā honti.
analyzed: dve bhikkhū saṅgha ādisesam āpannāḥ honti
translated: Two monks have committed an offense entailing suspension.

original: Te saṅghādisese saṅghādisesadiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: te saṅgha adisese saṅgha ādisesa diṭṭhinaḥ honti
translated: They regard the offense as an offense entailing suspension.

original: Te gacchanti ārocessāmāti.
analyzed: te gacchanti ārocessāma ati
translated: They go, thinking, “We’ll confess.”

original: Ekassa antarāmagge makkhadhammo uppajjati na ārocessāmīti.
analyzed: ekassa antarāmagge makkha dhammo uppajjati na ārocessāmi iti
translated: But on the way, one of them develops a wrong view, thinking, “I won’t confess.”

original: So paṭhamampi yāmaṁ chādeti, dutiyampi yāmaṁ chādeti, tatiyampi yāmaṁ chādeti—
analyzed: saḥ paṭhamam pi yāmam chādeti dutiyam pi yāmam chādeti tatiyam pi yāmam chādeti
translated: He conceals it during the first part of the night, during the second part of the night, and during the third part of the night.

original: uṭṭhite aruṇe channā hoti āpatti.
analyzed: uṭṭhite aruṇe channā hoti āpatti
translated: When dawn has risen, the offense is concealed.

original: Yo chādeti so dukkaṭaṁ desāpetabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ chādeti saḥ dukkaṭam desāpetabbaḥ
translated: The one who concealed it should be made to acknowledge an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṁ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṁ dātabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā paṭicchanne cassa parivāsam da tvā ubhinnam pi mānattam dātabba
translated: When they have each been given the trial period, probation should be given to both of them.

original: Dve bhikkhū saṅghādisesaṁ āpannā honti.
analyzed: dve bhikkhū saṅgha ādisesam āpannāḥ honti
translated: Two monks have committed an offense entailing suspension.

original: Te saṅghādisese saṅghādisesadiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: te saṅgha adisese saṅgha ādisesa diṭṭhinaḥ honti
translated: They regard the offense as an offense entailing suspension.

original: Te ummattakā honti.
analyzed: te ummattakāḥ honti
translated: They go insane.

original: Te pacchā anummattakā hutvā eko chādeti, eko nacchādeti.
analyzed: te pacchā anummattakāḥ hutvā ekaḥ chādeti ekaḥ na chādeti
translated: Later, when they have recovered from their insanity, one of them conceals the offense, while the other doesn’t.

original: Yo chādeti so dukkaṭaṁ desāpetabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ chādeti saḥ dukkaṭam desāpetabbaḥ
translated: The one who concealed it should be made to acknowledge an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṁ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṁ dātabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā paṭicchanne cassa parivāsam da tvā ubhinnam pi mānattam dātabba
translated: When they’ve each confessed, they should be given the trial period of six days.

original: Dve bhikkhū saṅghādisesaṁ āpannā honti.
analyzed: dve bhikkhū saṅgha ādisesam āpannāḥ honti
translated: Two monks have committed a number of offenses entailing suspension.

original: Te pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṁ vadanti—
analyzed: te pātimokkhe uddissamāne evam vadanti
translated: When the Monastic Code is being recited, they say,

original: ‘idāneva kho mayaṁ jānāma—
analyzed: idānīm iva khalu mayam jānāma
translated: ‘We only just found out

original: ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṁ uddesaṁ āgacchatī’ti.
analyzed: ayam pi kira dhammaḥ sutta āgataḥ sutta pariyāpanno anvaddha māsam uddesam āgacchati iti
translated: that this rule too has come down in the Monastic Code, that it’s to be recited every half-month.’

original: Te saṅghādisese saṅghādisesadiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: te saṅgha adisese saṅgha ādisesa diṭṭhinaḥ honti
translated: They regard the offenses entailing suspension as such.

original: Eko chādeti, eko nacchādeti.🔽Yo chādeti so dukkaṭaṁ desāpetabbo.
analyzed: ekaḥ chāda iti ekaḥ na chāda iti  yaḥ chādeti saḥ dukkaṭam desāpetabbaḥ
translated: One of them conceals his offenses, while the other doesn’t.🔽The one who conceals his offenses should be made to confess his offense of wrong conduct.

original: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṁ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṁ dātabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā paṭicchanne cassa parivāsam da tvā ubhinnam pi mānattam dātabba
translated: When he’s confessed, he should be given the trial period of six days.

original: Dvebhikkhuvāraekādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: niṭṭhita
translated: The group of eleven on two monks is finished.

original: 9. Mūlāyaavisuddhinavaka
translated: 9. The group of nine on purification by recollection

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi eka nāmam pi nānā nāmam pi sabhāgam pi visabhāgam pi vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: “It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts, both overlapping and not overlapping, both mixed and unmixed.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him that probation.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāyaḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.🔽Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati  tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those offenses.🔽The Sangha grants him that trial period, and it does so legitimately.🔽It gives him probation legitimately,

original: adhammena mānattaṁ deti, adhammena abbheti.
analyzed: adhammena mānattam deti adhammena abbheti
translated: but it gives him the trial period and rehabilitates him illegitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi eka nāmam pi nānā nāmam pi sabhāgam pi visabhāgam pi vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts, both being and not being concurrent.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him simultaneous probation for those offenses.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo paṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāyaḥ paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.🔽Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati  tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,🔽and the Sangha sends him back to the beginning in accordance with the rule. It then gives him simultaneous probation,

original: adhammena mānattaṁ deti, adhammena abbheti.
analyzed: adhammena mānattam deti adhammena abbheti
translated: but it gives him the trial period and sends him back to the beginning illegitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi eka nāmam pi nānā nāmam pi sabhāgam pi visabhāgam pi vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both with the same name and with various names, both of the same kind and of various kinds, both overlapping and not overlapping.🔽He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāyaḥ paṭicchannāyaḥ api appaṭicchannāyaḥ api
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both concealed and unconcealed.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: He asks the Sangha for rehabilitation from those offenses,

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti, adhammena mānattaṁ deti, adhammena abbheti.
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti adhammena mānattam deti adhammena abbheti
translated: and the Sangha rehabilitates him illegitimately, without grounds, unlawfully. It gives him simultaneous probation legitimately, but gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation illegitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi eka nāmam pi nānā nāmam pi sabhāgam pi visabhāgam pi vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both connected and unconnected, both of the same kind and connected and of different kinds and connected.🔽He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati aparimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo …pe…🔽aparimāṇāyo paṭicchannāyo …pe…
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati aparimāṇāyaḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ pe  aparimāṇāyaḥ paṭicchannāyaḥ pe
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, but he doesn’t remember all of them.🔽He remembers some of them, but not others.

original: aparimāṇāyo paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi …pe…
analyzed: aparimāṇāya paṭicchannāya api appaṭicchannāya api pe
translated: He remembers some of them, but not others.

original: parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi appaṭicchannāyo.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: parimāṇāya api aparimāṇāya api appaṭicchannāya  saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: He remembers some of them, but not others.🔽He asks the Sangha for the trial period for those offenses,🔽and the Sangha gives it to him.

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;🔽adhammena mānattaṁ deti, adhammena abbheti.
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti  adhammena mānattam deti adhammena abbheti
translated: But it gives him the trial period, the rehabilitation, and the sending back to the beginning illegitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi eka nāmam pi nānā nāmam pi sabhāgam pi visabhāgam pi vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts, both overlapping and not overlapping, both of which are canceled and of which are not canceled, and both that have and that haven’t already been confessed.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha has given him that probation.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāyaḥ api aparimāṇāyaḥ api paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both concealed and unconcealed.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.🔽Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati  tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those offenses.🔽The Sangha grants him that trial period, and it does so legitimately.🔽It gives him the probation legitimately,

original: adhammena mānattaṁ deti, adhammena abbheti.
analyzed: adhammena mānattam deti adhammena abbheti
translated: but it gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation illegitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi eka nāmam pi nānā nāmam pi sabhāgam pi visabhāgam pi vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both belonging to the same class and belonging to different classes, both concealed and unconcealed.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him that probation.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāya upi aparimāṇāya upi paṭicchannāya upi appaṭicchannāya upi  saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both concealed and unconcealed.🔽He’s asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those offenses.

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena;🔽dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;🔽adhammena mānattaṁ deti;
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena  dhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti  adhammena mānattam deti
translated: The Sangha grants him that trial period, and it does so legitimately.🔽It gives him the probation legitimately.

original: adhammena abbheti.
analyzed: adhammena abbheti
translated: It gives him the trial period illegitimately.🔽It rehabilitates him illegitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: Mūlāyaavisuddhinavakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: niṭṭhita
translated: The group of nine on purification is finished.

original: 10. Dutiyanavaka🔽Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: dutiya navaka  idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: . The second group of nine

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of a kind that have a fixed number of days and of a kind that do not, both of a kind that are clearable by confession and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by making amends and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by resolution and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by further action and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by acknowledgment and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are definite and of a kind that are indefinite, both of a kind that are curable and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are included in the group and of a kind that are not, and both of a kind that are included in the first and last class and of a kind that are not.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for those offenses.🔽The Sangha gives him that probation,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti, so parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā appaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: and while on probation he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those offenses.🔽The Sangha grants him that trial period, but it does so illegitimately and subject to reversal.

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: It gives him the rehabilitation legitimately,

original: dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: and it rehabilitates him legitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of a kind that have a fixed number of days and of a kind that do not.

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: both of a kind that are to be individually confessed and of a kind that are not.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He’s asking the Sangha for probation for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation for those offenses.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses committed while on probation.

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha sends him back to the beginning for those offenses committed while on probation, by means of a legal procedure that is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. It gives him the simultaneous probation,

original: dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: but the trial period and the rehabilitation, by means of a legitimate legal procedure.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.🔽Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi  idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both with a fixed number of days and with no fixed number of days.🔽He asks the Sangha to give him the simultaneous probation for those offenses.

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation for those offenses.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāya api appaṭicchannāya api
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both concealed and unconcealed.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: He asks the Sangha for rehabilitation from those offenses,

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha rehabilitates him illegitimately, by an incomplete legal procedure that should have been done legitimately. It gives him simultaneous probation,

original: dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: and it gives him the trial period, and it rehabilitates him.

original: So bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is not purified from those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi eka nāmam pi nānā nāmam pi sabhāgam pi visabhāgam pi vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both legally valid and invalid, both having the same name and having different names, both being complete and incomplete.🔽He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that simultaneous probation.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati aparimāṇā appaṭicchannāyo …pe…🔽aparimāṇā paṭicchannāyo …pe…🔽aparimāṇā paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi …pe…
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati aparimāṇāḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ pe  aparimāṇā paṭicchannāyaḥ pe  aparimāṇā paṭicchannāya api appaṭicchannāya api pe
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, but he doesn’t remember them all.🔽but he remembers some of them.🔽but he remembers some of them and not others.

original: parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi appaṭicchannāyo.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: parimāṇāya api aparimāṇāya api appaṭicchannāya  saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: but he remembers some of them and not others, and they are both specified and unspecified.🔽He asks the Sangha for the trial period for those offenses,🔽and the Sangha gives it to him illegitimately and by an incomplete assembly.

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;🔽dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti  dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: It then gives him the rehabilitation legitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.🔽Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi  idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: That monk is impure because of those offenses.

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of a kind that have a fixed number of days in the process of rehabilitation and of a kind that do not, both that have already been dealt with and that have not yet been dealt with.

original: So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: He asks the Sangha for the simultaneous probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: The Sangha gives him simultaneous probation for those offenses.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyo.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāyaḥ api aparimāṇāyaḥ api paṭicchannāyaḥ  saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both concealed and unconcealed.🔽He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses committed while on probation,

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti, dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: and the Sangha does so, using an illegitimate legal procedure that’s reversible and unfit to stand. It then gives him simultaneous probation illegitimately, gives him the trial period of six days legitimately, and rehabilitates him legitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.🔽Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi  idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: That monk is still impure regarding those offenses.

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of a kind that have a fixed number of days and of a kind that don’t, both of a kind that are clearable by confession and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by making good a transgression and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by further penalty and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by a majority decision and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by information and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by having seen and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by acknowledgment and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by resolution and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by further penalty and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by a majority decision and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by information and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by having seen and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by acknowledgment and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are clearable by resolution and of a kind that are not, both of a kind that are definite and of a kind that are indefinite, both of a kind that are included in the group and of a kind that are not, and both of a kind that are mixed and of a kind that are not.🔽He asks the Sangha to give him simultaneous probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives it to him.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāya upi aparimāṇāya upi paṭicchannāya upi appaṭicchannāya upi  saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both concealed and unconcealed.🔽He asks the Sangha for rehabilitation from those offenses,

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha rehabilitates him illegitimately, with a faction that is incomplete, and then gives him simultaneous probation illegitimately.

original: dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: It then gives him the trial period of six days legitimately and rehabilitates him legitimately.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu a visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is still impure regarding those offenses.

original: Dutiyanavakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: dutiya navakam niṭṭhita
translated: The second group of nine is finished.

original: 11. Tatiyanavaka🔽Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: tatiya navaka  idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: . The third group of nine

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of a kind that have a fixed number of days and of a kind that do not, both specified and unspecified, both of a kind that have a fixed number of days and of a kind that do not, both concealed and unconcealed.🔽He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that simultaneous probation.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.🔽So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāyaḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ  saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified.🔽He asks the Sangha for the trial period for those offenses,

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him the trial period, but illegitimately and by an incomplete assembly that is complete in terms of the offense.

original: So parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: so parivasāmi iti maññamānaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇāyaḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: Thinking that he’s on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified.

original: So tasmiṁ bhūmiyaṁ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarati, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarati.
analyzed: saḥ tasmin bhūmiyam ṭhitaḥ purima āāpattīnam antarā āpattiyaḥ sarati aparā āpattīnam antarā āāpattiyaḥ sarati
translated: While on probation, he remembers some of the earlier offenses, but not others. He remembers some of the later offenses, but not others.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—🔽‘ahaṁ kho sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…🔽vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: tassa evam hoti  aham kho sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe  vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: He thinks,

original: Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ uham saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: ‘I’ve committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of a kind that have a fixed number of days for the trial period and of a kind that don’t, both of a kind that are clearable by confession and of a kind that are clearable by further ritual.🔽I’ve asked the Sangha to give me the trial period for those offenses,

original: Tassa me saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: The Sangha gave me simultaneous probation for those offenses.

original: Sohaṁ parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim parimāṇāyaḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ  saḥ ham saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: While on probation, I committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.🔽I asked the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for those offenses,

original: Taṁ maṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassi adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tam mama saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassi adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha did so, but it did so illegitimately and in a way that was reversible and grounds for schism. It then gave me simultaneous probation illegitimately.

original: Sohaṁ parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivasāmi iti maññamānaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim parimāṇāyaḥ appaṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: Thinking that I was on probation, I committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

original: Sohaṁ tasmiṁ bhūmiyaṁ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi.🔽Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca
analyzed: saḥ aham tasmin bhūmiyam ṭhitaḥ purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattiyaḥ sarāmi apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattiyaḥ sarāmi 🔽yat nūna aham saṅgham purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca
translated: I remember the offenses committed while on probation, both those that I committed before and those that I committed after.🔽I ask the Sangha to give me simultaneous probation for those offenses committed before and those committed after.

original: mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāceyyaṁ dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ;🔽dhammena mānattaṁ, dhammena abbhānan’ti.
analyzed: mūlāya paṭikassanam yāceyyam dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsa  dhammena mā ānatta dhammena abbhānanti
translated: I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those earlier and later offenses that are subject to acknowledgment, to be given according to the rule, not to be canceled.🔽I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those earlier and later offenses that are subject to acknowledgment, to be given according to the rule, not to be canceled.🔽I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those earlier and later offenses that are subject to acknowledgment, to be given according to the rule, not to be canceled.

original: So saṅghaṁ purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ;🔽dhammena mānattaṁ, dhammena abbhānaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsa  dhammena mānatta dhammena abbhāna
translated: The Sangha gives the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for those earlier and later offenses that are subject to acknowledgment, to be given according to the rule, not to be canceled.🔽The Sangha gives the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for those earlier and later offenses that are subject to acknowledgment, to be given according to the rule, not to be canceled.

original: Taṁ saṅgho purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti;🔽dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti  dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: The Sangha gives the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for those earlier and later offenses that are subject to acknowledgment, to be given according to the rule, not to be canceled.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu visuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi
translated: That monk is purified from those offenses.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: “It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified. …

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: “It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of the same name and of various names, both of the same kind and of various kinds, both of the same sort and of various sorts, both concealed and unconcealed.🔽He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha gives him that probation.

original: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: saḥ parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, specified and unconcealed.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
translated: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

original: Taṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassati, adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam deti
translated: and the Sangha does so, but it gives him simultaneous probation unlawfully, by means of a legal procedure that is reversible and unfit to stand.

original: So parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.
analyzed: so parivasāmi iti maññamānaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyaḥ
translated: Thinking that he’s on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, specified and unconcealed.

original: So tasmiṁ bhūmiyaṁ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarati, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarati.
analyzed: saḥ tasmin bhūmiyam ṭhitaḥ purima āāpattīnam antarā āpattiyaḥ sarati aparā āpattīnam antarā āāpattiyaḥ sarati
translated: He remembers the earlier offenses while he’s on that level, and he remembers the subsequent offenses while he’s on that level.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—🔽‘ahaṁ kho sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…🔽vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
analyzed: tassa evam hoti  aham kho sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe  vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi
translated: He thinks,

original: Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ uham saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yāci
translated: ‘I’ve committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of which are clearable by confession and unconfessed.🔽I’ve asked the Sangha to give me probation for those offenses,

original: Tassa me saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tassa me saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam adāsi

original: Sohaṁ parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.🔽Sohaṁ saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāciṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivasantaḥ antarā sambahulāḥ saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim parimāṇā paṭicchannāyaḥ  saḥ ham saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yāci
translated: While on probation, I’ve committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, specified and unconcealed.🔽I’ve asked the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for those offenses,

original: Taṁ maṁ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāya paṭikassi, adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: tam mama saṅghaḥ antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassi adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhāna arahena adhammena samodhāna parivāsam adāsi
translated: and the Sangha has sent me back to the beginning, by means of a legitimate legal procedure that can’t be revoked, and has given me probation illegitimately.

original: Sohaṁ parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṁ parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.🔽Sohaṁ tasmiṁ bhūmiyaṁ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi.
analyzed: saḥ ham parivasāmi iti maññamānaḥ antarā sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjim parimāṇā paṭicchannāyaḥ  saḥ aham tasmin bhūmiyam ṭhitaḥ purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattiyaḥ sarāmi apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattiyaḥ sarāmi
translated: Thinking that I was undertaking the trial period, I committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and concealed.🔽I remember the offenses I committed while on probation, both specified and concealed.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca,
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca
translated: I should ask the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for those offenses committed while on probation, both specified and concealed,🔽and to give me the trial period of six days, in accordance with the rule,

original: mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yāceyyaṁ dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ,
analyzed: mūlāya paṭikassanam yāceyyam dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsa
translated: and to give me the trial period of six days, in accordance with the rule,

original: dhammena mānattaṁ, dhammena abbhānan’ti.🔽So saṅghaṁ purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ🔽yācati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ, dhammena
analyzed: dhammena mā ānatta dhammena abbhānanti  saḥ saṅgham purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca mūlāya paṭikassana  yācati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsa dhammena
translated: and to rehabilitate me.”🔽He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses committed while on probation, both specified and concealed,🔽and to give him the trial period of six days, in accordance with the rule,

original: mānattaṁ, dhammena abbhānaṁ.
analyzed: mānatta dhammena abbhāna
translated: and to give him the trial period of six days, in accordance with the rule,🔽and to rehabilitate him.

original: Taṁ saṅgho purimāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṁ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāya🔽paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṁ
analyzed: tam saṅghaḥ purima āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca apara āāpattīnam antara āāpattīnam ca mūlāya  paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena dhammena samodhāna parivāsa
translated: The Sangha sends him back to the beginning for those previous and intermediate offenses,🔽and it then gives him the trial period of six days according to the rule for the trial period of six days.

original: deti, dhammena mānattaṁ deti, dhammena abbheti.
analyzed: deti dhammena mānattam deti dhammena abbheti
translated: It then gives him the rehabilitation according to the rule for rehabilitation.

original: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu visuddho tāhi āpattīhi.🔽Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu visuddhaḥ tāhi āpattīhi  idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu sambahulā saṅgha ādisesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi aparimāṇam pi pe
translated: That monk is purified from those offenses.

original: vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.🔽So saṅghaṁ tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: vavatthitam pi sambhinnam pi  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam yācati
translated: It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both with a fixed number of days in suspension and without a fixed number of days in suspension, both of the same kind and of various kinds, both of which are clearable by confession and by undertaking a training rule.🔽He asks the Sangha for the trial period of six days for those offenses,

original: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṁ āpattīnaṁ samodhānaparivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: tassa saṅghaḥ tāsam āpattīnam samodhāna parivāsam deti

translated: While on trial, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both with a fixed number of days in suspension and without a fixed number of days in suspension, both of the same kind and of various kinds, both of which are clearable by confession and by undertaking a training rule.

original: So saṅghaṁ antarāāpattīnaṁ mūlāyapaṭikassanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham antarā āpattīnam mūlāya paṭikassanam yācati
